notes: irregular present (so, sai, sa, sappiamo, sapete, sanno); used with auxiliary avere; past participle 'saputo'.
example_sentence_english: I want to know the truth.
Knowing this, I leave right away.
Did you know about the change?
You did not know the number.
Did you find out the news?

translation_english: he has found out/she has found out/you (formal) have found out
notes: used with auxiliary avere; also used as formal 'Lei'
example_sentence_english: He found out about the delay.
Did you find out about the course?
